Marty Olevitch
value 0xD0CC
Hardware and software details.
unsigned long buffer_count
Sequential count of buffers sent.
Struct that returns details about the current buffer.
unsigned short byte_offset_to_science_data
Offset in bytes from the beginning of the buffer to the start of science data.
unsigned short checksum
Checksum of the science bytes.
Building the library and applications.
Format of data sent to and received from the boards.
Get it here: http://cosray.wustl.edu/~marty/anita/liblos.tar.bz2.
value 0xC0FE
How do you do it?
value 0xDA
value 0xAE00
Various bugs and problems.
Version 2.5e
int los_end(void)
Shuts down the LOS telemetry system.
int los_init(unsigned char bus,
unsigned char slot,
int intr,
int wr,
int ms)
Initializes LOS telemetry communications.
Maximum number of science bytes that can be handled by liblos.
Maximum number of science words (16 bits) that can be handled by liblos.
int los_read(struct buffer_info *bufinfo,
unsigned char *buf,
short *nbytes)
Read data from the LOS telemetry board.
void los_reset(void)
Issue a software reset to the LOS board.
unsigned int los_set_delay_factor(unsigned int df)
After writing a buffer to the telemetry board, we pause for a number of milliseconds proportional to the size of the buffer according to the following formula:
char *los_strerror(void)
Get information about the most recent error.
char *los_version(void)
Return a C-string giving the version number of the library.
int los_write(unsigned char *buf,
short nbytes)
Write data to the LOS telemetry board (and from there to the GSE).

Number of bytes of science data.

unsigned short status
The ID_HDR for this buffer.
